description: Please add feature to change duration.

I logged a few pomodoros on day #1. On day #2 I clicked a "reset timer" button which should only reset the currently active timer. Instead, it deleted all history. If this had happened after accumulating a few days/weeks/months of data, I would be *extremely* upset.

I would advise against using this app until this issue has been resolved properly: https://gitlab.com/idevecore/pomodoro/-/issues/11
summary: Beware, this app will trivially delete data

description:
No nonsense, just does what it says. 
Has efficiency stats as a bonus. Awesome work by the devs!
Sort of useless if you want to have shorter timers.
Can customize the timers, work in the background on GNOME unlike solanum, has statistics and history.

It is not an everyday timer for your sunday roasts, it is a productivity timer, and it's adjustable in many ways.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pomodoro_Technique
Runs great and helps a lot, but adjustable times (increasing work-cycle time or break-time) would be great.
love the simplistic design, includes everything you need and works perfectly fine
I forgot how effective the pomodoro method was for me. This has totally killed procrastination for me! Simple, elegant UI, especially for Gnome users.

I don't understand the need to complicate things and ask to fill a title and description to the timer, I need to use the tool, not "describe it". 
If you don't do that step, the timer doesn't start... why?
summary: It cannot be used without filling out the form, why?

description: Works great and looks great. I would love to see more sound options for both the end of the focus and break session. It's still a 5 star for me. Thank you for deveolping this!

Works flawlesly, just run and play.
Some nice options and features too.
